protein.specific_function: High-affinity sodium/citrate cotransporter that mediates citrate entry into cells. The transport process is electrogenic; it is the trivalent form of citrate rather than the divalent form that is recognized as a substrate. May facilitate the utilization of circulating citrate for the generation of metabolic energy and for the synthesis of fatty acids and cholesterol

reference.reference_text: Inoue K, Zhuang L, Ganapathy V: Human Na+ -coupled citrate transporter: primary structure, genomic organization, and transport function. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2002 Dec 6;299(3):465-71.
